page.title: 13THE PARK WALL-INCE BLUNDELL
page.content:
The{Park Wall}was begun in{1770}and is a prominent landmark in the area. It is believed to have been a scheme for unemployment relief. Clay for the bricks was dug from pits close at hand. the largest of these is now the beautiful lake inside the park.Five kilns were set up to bake the bricks.
On the wall{white crosses}are painted. These mark the position of wooden crosses inside the wal.At these points funeral processions would stop to say prayers and rest on the way to the cemetery.(Before the Reformation this would have been at Sefton Church)
The whole area inside the Park Wall is now a Conservation area.
